"How to Get Media Attention and Promote Your Group" 

In this intensive training workshop, activists will be taught the ins and outs of the following: 

Writing effective letters to the editor
Writing effective press releases 
Holding press conferences and carrying out publicity stunts
Preparing talking points for media appearances
Handling yourself on radio, TV, and with print reporters

Also covered will be powerful ways to use online social media. For many volunteer groups this has the advantage of no cost and less formality. And many activists are already involved in social media and simply need to focus their efforts more organizationally. Included in this topic area are ideas on the following: 

Developing an improved Web presence
Spreading your message through Facebook
Making effective use of blogs and online forums
Producing viral videos   

The secret behind all of this is "message clarification" in advance of media campaigns. It's the core of this no-nonsense, succeed-every-time seminar that has been given to groups all over the country as UnitedCoR builds and promotes local coalitions from coast to coast. Practical handouts will be provided, but come prepared to take notes.

Your seminar presenter is Fred Edwords, national director of the United Coalition of Reason. He has over 35 years experience in freethought leadership, having served as executive director of the American Humanist Association, editor of the Humanist magazine, and president of Camp Quest.
